question: 滑る
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>slippery</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to slide</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to slip</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You're about <vocabulary>to slip</vocabulary>, and notice the floor is covered entirely in <reading>souve</reading>nirs (<ja>すべ</ja>)! Souvenirs of all shapes and sizes are scattered all over the floor, making it extremely easy to slide and slip.
